Trey Brosnan
CS at Carnegie Mellon (Math minor). I build interactive systems, AI tooling, and real-time 3D.

I'm a Computer Science student at Carnegie Mellon University (expected May 2026) specializing in interactive XR-style experiences, AI systems, and real-time 3D graphics. I've built AI coding tools used by 100k+ creators, shipped production backends with robust validation and retry logic, and developed immersive web experiences using Three.js, WebGL, and physics engines. I work across Python, TypeScript, Go, and C/C#, with a focus on performance-minded engineering and systems that actually ship.

How to play

Desktop

  • WASD: move
  • Mouse: look (pointer lock)
  • Click: grab or release
  • ESC: pause menu

Touch

  • Left stick: move
  • Right side: look
  • Tap: interact
  • Menu: pause menu
Hand tracking is optional. Use the button on the onboarding screen to enable it.
